data.title: Refactor FileUtils::getFileData() and CCFreeTypeFont::loadFont().
data.body:
- Remove unnecessary memory copy in `FileUtils::getFileData()`
- Add `Data::takeBuffer()` to simplify `FileUtils::getFileData()` and `CCFreeTypeFont::loadFont()`.

data.title: started Release Notes changes for v3.11
data.body:
started to update and refine the release notes for v3.11
- added some bold instead of everything being enclosed in back-ticks
- added some wording about running the samples for each platform
- added some text for Tizen support and a link to the where the official docs will be
- clarified some wording about OpenSSL upgrade.

PLEASE DO NOT MERGE YET. MORE CHANGES COMING.

data.body:
See:
https://github.com/cocos2d/cocos2d-x/pull/15473#issuecomment-213562896

Steps to reproduce:
1) Create a CCLabel
2) label->setText("ðŸ‘ðŸ‘ŠðŸ’"); // See https://github.com/cocos2d/cocos2d-x/blob/v3/tests/cpp-tests/Classes/UITest/CocoStudioGUITest/UIEditBoxTest.cpp#L67 if the Unicode chars aren't showing up.

Expected:
Same glyphs show up

Actual:
Box glyphs show up

@stammen @minggo Feel free to assign to me.  I should have bandwidth next week to look into this.

data.title: Getting different values stored with scientific notation in a plist.
data.body:
I'm reading the plist using`FileUtils::getInstance()->getValueMapFromFile(path)` and then reading the value using `asFloat()`.

For example: if you save the number 1.52587890625E-05 in a plist and then try to read it, the correct decimal number (0.0000152587890625) will be returned in iOS, however in android it will return the number 1.52587890625.

Xcode will automatically convert numbers to scientific notation. If you write the number 0.0000152587890625 using Xcode it will actually be actually stored as 1.52587890625E-05.

I'm using v3.9 by the way.

data.title: .cocos-project.json file not found.
data.body:
I upgraded from 3.8.1 to 3.10.0 yesterday. I ran the `cocos` command only to find that it couldn't find the `.cocos-project.json` file. Typically I have this in the `<Cocos2d-x-path>/frameworks/runtime-src`. After some investigation I saw that the `cocos` script invokes bash with `#!/bin/bash -l` (it runs the script as if it was ran in a new terminal). In my case, this will always change the directory into the home directory. So it attempts to find the file at `~/.cocos-project.json`. Sure enough, after removing the `-l`, it worked.

Is this the intended behavior of this script? Is there a specific reason the `cocos` script needs to be opened as if it was opened in a new terminal? I'm assuming the idea is to prevent path pollution from the environment. I find "polluting" the path useful, especially when testing different configurations, or changing environment variables before I run certain scripts which require a certain configuration.

So, is this a bug? Feature?

Thank you!

data.title: [bug]PageView::pageTurningEvent doesn't work
data.body:
[bug]PageView::pageTurningEvent doesn't work
@zilongshanren 

The lua test project about ccui.PageViewEventType.turning is invalid

```
    local function pageViewEvent(sender, eventType)
        if eventType == ccui.PageViewEventType.turning then
            local pageInfo = string.format("page %d " , pageView:getCurPageIndex() + 1)
            self._displayValueLabel:setString(pageInfo)
        end
    end
    pageView:addEventListener(pageViewEvent)
```

the ver is v3.10

data.title: Add OBB (zip) support
data.body:
This pull request adds support for OBB files.
OBB must be a zip file with audio and video files stored uncompressed.
The data must be at the root of the OBB (not in an assets folder like in the APK),

For example, in the assets folder, the OBB can be created with: 
`zip -rn .ogg:.mp3:.wav:.mp4 main.<version>.<android package name>.obb *`

Tested with CppTests, either with assets in the APK (to confirm there is no regression) or in the OBB.

Using the new AudioEngine with OBB is only supported on Android 3.1 (API level 12) or above.

data.title: Add CC_GUI_DLL to suppress warning C4275
data.body:
When building `libcocos2d_8_1.Windows.vcxproj` and `libcocos2d_8_1.WindowsPhone.vcxproj`, I get the following warning:

```
cocos\ui/UIEditBox/UIEditBoxImpl-winrt.h(107): warning C4275: non dll-interface class 'cocos2d::ui::EditBoxImplCommon' used as base for dll-interface class 'cocos2d::ui::UIEditBoxImplWinrt'
```

This pull request adds `CC_GUI_DLL` prefix to suppress that warning. Thanks!
